text: Table 10-2. Key Interfaces Supported by Classes of System.Collections System.Collections Meaning in Life Interface ICollection Defines general characteristics (e.g., size, enumeration, and thread safety) for all nongeneric collection types ICloneable Allows the implementing object to return a copy of itself to the caller IDictionary Allows a nongeneric collection object to represent its contents using key-value pairs IEnumerable Returns an object implementing the IEnumerator interface (see next table entry) IEnumerator Enables foreach-style iteration of collection items IList Provides behavior to add, remove, and index items in a sequential list of objects
